Senior Consultant, Deloitte Consulting

2016-09 — Present

Senior Data Scientist in the service line Analytics & Cognitive, part of the Big Data and Advanced Analytics Community working with clients doing Machine learning development and deployment.

  • Using Graph Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for Anti-money laundering (AML) modelling on graph data.
  • Predicting adverse gambling behavior using ensemble models on transactional data.
  • Quality inspection on a production line using traditional CNNs with images as input.
  • Predicting relevant spare parts and man hours for claims based on inventory data of historic claims using ensemble models.
  • Deep learning models to improve the quality of scanned documents using auto encoders and extracting information from documents using object detection models and Recurrent neural networks (RNNs) for interpretation.
  • Identifying and implementing a machine learning platform. Formulating best practices for development.
  • Classifying a large number of documents using topic models and neural network methods such as doc2vec. Processing said documents using Spark on Hadoop.
Machine learning, Data Science, MLOps, Python, Alteryx, TensorFlow, PyTorch

writing

Econ and Data, Andreas Keller Leth Laursen

2016

My personal web site powered by gamgee. Writing about economic and financial data analysis and statistical programming.

An Empirical Comparison of Models for Forecasting Electricity Prices, Andreas Keller Leth Laursen

2015

Master's thesis testing the performance of classical time series models against the performance of the machine learning model support vector machines. The models were applied on the German and French day-ahead and intraday power market. A GARCH model with a jump process with time varying intensity was found to be the best model.

Comparing Support Vector Machines to Classical Time Series Models: An Empirical Application on the Power Market, Andreas Keller Leth Laursen

2015

Topic paper testing the performance of support vector machines in forecasting with simple econometric models as benchmarks. Support vector machines were found to be on par with simple econometric models (ARMA) for absolute forecast, but was beat by logistic regression for directional forecasting (classification).

On the Stock Market and Capital Accumulation, Andreas Keller Leth Laursen, Kristian Tanggaard

2014

Project paper where the capital accumulation model of Robert E. Hall's 2001 paper the Stock Market and Capital Accumulation was reexamined and tested on an updated dataset.

Forecasting Performance of Asymmetric Volatility Models, Andreas Keller Leth Laursen, Jeppe Toft Andersen

2014

Project paper testing the performance of various assymetric volatility models such as E-GARCH, GJR-GARCH and A-GARCH.

Econometric Tests for Bubbles in the Danish Housing Market, Andreas Keller Leth Laursen, Kristian Tanggaard

2013

Bachelor's thesis applying econometrics models for detecting bubbles in the stock market where applied on the danish housing market. We found evidence for bubbles in the housing market, in particular in the period 2000-2007. These bubbles could have been detected had they been run before the housing market crashed.
